chunks.content: Her first acting role of 2006 was in the comedy film The Pink Panther starring opposite Steve Martin, grossing $158.8 million at the box office worldwide. Her second film Dreamgirls, the film version of the 1981 Broadway musical loosely based on The Supremes, received acclaim from critics and grossed $154 million internationally.

metadata.topic: Beyoncé's early acting roles and film successes

chunks.content: In it, she starred opposite Jennifer Hudson, Jamie Foxx, and Eddie Murphy playing a pop singer based on Diana Ross. To promote the film, Beyoncé released 'Listen' as the lead single from the soundtrack album.

metadata.topic: Beyoncé's role in Dreamgirls and soundtrack promotion

chunks.content: In April 2007, Beyoncé embarked on The Beyoncé Experience, her first worldwide concert tour, visiting 97 venues and grossed over $24 million. Beyoncé conducted pre-concert food donation drives during six major stops in conjunction with her pastor at St. John's and America's Second Harvest.

metadata.topic: The Beyoncé Experience concert tour and charitable efforts

chunks.content: At the same time, B'Day was re-released with five additional songs, including her duet with Shakira 'Beautiful Liar'.

metadata.topic: Re-release of B'Day and new music
